Title: Tim Collins
Content:
"So, let me first say congratulations to Mohammed, my dear friend,  and your family and everybody involved in this remarkable collection of philanthropic efforts that you're celebrating.

I've known Mohammed for more than 20 years.  For a period of a decade we met all around the world.  I have to say I've known many many business leaders and philanthropists and Mohammed, in particular, is among the most creative driven professional, brilliant, entrepreneurial, in both his commercial and philanthropic activities.

Frankly, I think you know in a funny way, he has taken the best of his part of the world, where altruism is a part of the everyday life and their faith and friendship is paramount; and the lessons learned in Japan about about efficiency and data-driven decisions; and the West where entrepreneurial spirit is the animating spirit of of the Western economy.   And that mix is an amazing amalgamation that has created amazing things.

And then you couldn't speak about the capstone of 75 years without speaking about the Abdul Latif Jameel Poverty Action Lab at MIT.   It is a remarkable data-driven, results-oriented, hands-on effort to address some of the world's most intractable problems and gets results.

It is just like the other uh activities of of the Jameel organization.  It is brilliant. Tt is it is creative, and they won the Nobel Prize.  So, I guess that's sort of all you need to know, is they won the Nobel Prize.

So, congratulations 75 years of remarkable, remarkable, achievements. . .   and here's to another 75 years!

And Mohammed, in particular, here's to the two of us enjoying the next 75 years together with  the friendship that we've shared that I so cherish."

Title: Prof. Muhammad Yunus
Content:
"Hearty Congratulations to Community Jameel on its 75th Anniversary

I am delighted to extend my warm congratulations to the Community Jameel on celebrating 75 years of philanthropy!

This anniversary is a time for reflecting on the past and looking ahead to the future.

I am pleased by the Community Jameel's groundbreaking work that they continue to conduct on the most pressing issues of the world.  They are working towards delivering quality education with disruptive mechanisms in technology, teaching methods, mentorship and programs globally.  The ultimate goal is to eradicate barriers to learning. In the arena of health, they aim to improve healthcare facilities, especially for the poor, using technology like machine learning, robotics and data science.  To tackle the climate crisis, they are working to provide food and water security for everyone with the help of unique technologies.  They conduct intensive research in labs to test what will work in real life and what will not.  No matter what kind of change they are aspiring to make, they do it through evidence-based research within the spheres of data, science, and technology.

Our work on microcredit was chosen by Community Jameel to focus their attention on.  The Community supported US based Grameen Foundation’s -- Grameen Jameel Initiative to provide Microfinance in several countries in the North Africa, the Middle East, including Saudi Arabia.  It also supported a French initiative to produce a feature film on Grameen Bank and me.

Mohammed Jameel decided to fund the Poverty Action Lab at his alma mater MIT.  It was inspired by Grameen Bank in Bangladesh and was designed to generating creative ideas to solve global poverty.

Mohammed Jameel made me a part of the organization he created called Coexist Foundation.  This aimed at interfaith understanding and dialogue.

His representative Tim Ryan supported us on media coverage pro bono for the Nobel Prize events in Oslo in 2006, helping to arrange some of the interviews at the time.

I am very lucky to have friendship with Mohammed Jameel to see his work at a close range.  He is making great contributions to uplift the population which is forgotten by the mainstream decisions and policies.

I send all my good wishes on this occasion of 75th Anniversary to Mohammed, and his organizations, in their journey to making the world a better place."

Professor Muhammad Yunus

Title: Lubna S. Olayan
Content:
Congratulations on the 75th Anniversary of Abdul Latif Jameel!

It is a great milestone, one that does not just happen.  It is the result of the vision, hard work, risk taking and sacrifice of the founder, your dear father, may he rest in peace.

I know that, because we share the wonderful legacy of having founders who saw beyond the challenges and focused on the possibilities they saw instead, and then made it happen.  And, who all along the way, made it possible and better for others in their community, empowering them and supporting the development of Saudi Arabia, well before anyone coined the term CSR.

We all owe a great debt to these pioneers, who as they grew small businesses into Saudi conglomerates with international reach never lost sight of their Saudi roots and heritage, in which they took great pride.

I am sure your dear father would be so very proud to see how well his children and now his grandchildren have not only sustained his core values, but have grown the business, embraced a pioneering spirit to blaze new trails with an entrepreneurial and innovative flair and supported through a world-renowned philanthropic arm the many communities the business touches, all while remaining true to the Saudi roots from which it all grew.

It has been a great pleasure for me to have gained these insights into your values and approach to business and life firsthand through serving together on various boards. You truly embody the generous spirit of the broader organization.  So, it is not surprising that I often find myself running into someone who knows you, likes you and respects what you, Community Jameel and the other philanthropic arms are doing.

That's a great legacy that will propel Abdul Latif Jameel into a wonderfully bright and rewarding future.

Warm regards

Lubna S. Olayan

Title: Dr. Arundhati Tuli Banerjee
Content:
"So, Mohammed Jameel and his family, they've had a - he's an alumnus at MIT - and they've had a long relationship with MIT before I even came to MIT.  I first got to me him, in my role, when we started to talk about the potential of the Abdul Latif Jameel action lab on water and food security systems [The Abdul Latif Jameel Water & Food Systems Lab (J-WAFS)] and we got started on a journey trying to think of what 'impact' means in the world.

I would describe Mohammed Jameel as someone who is a man of ideas.  So he told me once that "I have a hundred ideas a week and you don't have to take them all seriously, but I enjoy discussing these ideas with people who enjoy intellectual discussions."  And the way it has always worked, so far as I have seen, with Mohammed and all of us at MIT, is that we start with the 'big idea' and then we take a look at: for this to be accomplished, what would be needed?  Who are the people?  How would this be done?  if its a question of poverty, or food and water, or health, what would be the nuances in each and every context across the different parts of the world?

And he's always hands-on.  He likes to be in these conversations, not because he needs to have any control over these conversations, but because he enjoys the intellectual journey.  That's how I see him.  He's a man of ideas most of all, and someone who's truly committed to making a difference in the world.

He loves to amplify our message in ways we may not have been able to do without him, in terms of bringing this to the attention of different kinds of people across the world.  Whether it's governments; whether it's non-profits; whether it's educational institutions - he's been very, very active.  He and Community Jameel.  I should say a word about the incredible team that's at Community Jameel that works very closely with us as well.

I want to congratulate you, and I want to thank you Mohammed, Fady, Hassan and Community Jameel, for allowing us to be part of your family's legacy to the world because what you do is incredible and for us to be a small part of it is just absolutely inspiring."

Title: Khalid bin Hamad Al-Malik
Content:
This year marks the 75th Anniversary of the start of the Abdul Latif Jameel Company.  If we look at the history of Abdul Latif Jameel, we may feel that its' late founder wanted the company to combine trading with charitable and humanitarian work, as if he had intended to link charitable work with commercial activity, maybe based on his conviction that his trade will not be profitable unless the poor and needy have a share of the profits and proceeds of investments of this giant corporation. He must have instructed his sons to continue and increase these initiatives after him.

On the occasion of the passage of 75 years since the establishment of Abdul Latif Jameel, perhaps we should shed light on the charitable organizations and initiatives launched by Abdul Latif Jameel to reflect their concerns towards the needy inside and outside the Kingdom.  This interest was particularly reflected in Community Jameel's charitable orientation towards building a better future through job creation, innovation, entrepreneurship, and youth creativity in the Kingdom and in our region, as part of a set of programs offered by the Jameel businesses to beneficiaries within the Kingdom.

It is out of this outstanding charitable, humanitarian and patriotic approach, the idea of ​​'Bab Rizq Jameel' was born, in order to provide job opportunities for young people. This includes support and financing for entrepreneurs, provision of digital services for the benefit of entrepreneurs and small and medium-sized enterprises, in addition to what this charitable section does in terms of linking job seekers with employers.

Bab Rizq Jameel is not a single organization  but rather a group of businesses.  There is employment, another for financing, and a third for services.  In each company, there is a set of services with many details, and tight regulations.   As part of Bab Rizq Jameel, a women's arts and crafts academy was established. There is also MIT Enterprise Forum, along with Community Jameel's humanitarian initiatives, all of which share the same goals: care for people's health; prisoner welfare; build mosques; supporting low-income families, widows' families and divorced women, and provide housing for the needy, including rent, furniture, equipment, and much more.

Community Jameel is one that is based on solidarity, humanitarian work, and helping citizens to depend on themselves by providing them with job and education opportunities under the umbrella of Bab Rizq Jameel and other organizations and sections of Abdul Latif Jameel.   Together, these initiatives demonstrate that the sons followed the example of their founding father, and yet expanded in this direction with a clear focus on the same goals set by the founder in serving the people, thanks to the good fortune that Allah Almighty bestowed upon them, and the support and encourage they received from our leadership in those prestigious initiatives.

مبادرات جميل الاجتماعية: سباق بين الأب وأبنائه

بقلم: خالد الـمالك*

رئيس تحرير صحيفة الجزيرة، رئيس هيئة الصحفيين السعودية، رئيس اتحاد الصحافة الخليجية

يصادف هذا العام مرور 75 سنة على انطلاقة شركة عبد اللطيف جميل، وكأن مؤسسها - رحمه الله - أراد أن تكون الشركة جامعة بين التجارة والأعمال الخيرية والإنسانية، وكأنه قد تعمَّد ربط العمل الخيري بالعمل التجاري؛ انطلاقاً من قناعته بأن تجارته لن تكون رابحة ما لم يكن للفقراء وذوي الحاجة نصيب من ربح هذه المؤسسة العملاقة، وما يتحقق لها من ريع استثماراتها، ولا بد أنه أوصى أبناءه على استمرار هذه المبادرات وزيادتها بعد وفاته.

هذه المناسبة، تذكِّرنا مع مرور ثلاثة أرباع القرن على إنشاء هذه الشركة، بما تولَّد عنها من أذرعة ومؤسسات ومبادرات خيرية، تصب وتتجه اهتماماتها نحو المحتاجين داخل المملكة وخارجها، مع تميز هذا التوجه الخيري في مجتمع جميل نحو بناء مستقبل أفضل من خلال خلق فرص العمل والابتكار، وريادة الأعمال، وإبداع الشباب في المملكة وفي منطقتنا، ضمن مجموعة من البرامج التي تقدمها مجموعة جميل للمستفيدين داخل المملكة.

وكمثال على هذا التوجه الخيري والإنساني والوطني الجميل، ولدت فكرة "باب رزق جميل"؛ من أجل توفير فرص العمل للشباب من الجنسين، يشمل ذلك الدعم والتمويل لرواد الأعمال، وتوفير الخدمات الرقمية لفائدة رواد الأعمال والمؤسسات الصغيرة والمتوسطة، إلى جانب ما يقوم به هذا الباب الخيري من ربط بين الباحثين عن عمل بأصحاب الأعمال.

و"باب رزق جميل" ليست مؤسسة أو شركة واحدة، وإنما هي مجموعة من الشركات، فهناك شركة للتوظيف، وأخرى للتمويل، وثالثة خاصة بالخدمات، وفي كل شركة مجموعة من الخدمات بتفاصيل كثيرة، وتنظيمات محكمة، وضمن هذا الباب تم تأسيس أكاديمية للفنون والحرف خاصة بالنساء، وهناك منتدى MIT لريادة الأعمال، إلى جانب مبرات جميل، وأوقاف جميل، وإفراج جميل، وشفاء جميل، وقوت جميل، وسكن جميل، وقلم جميل، وكلها فروع تخاطب الحس الإنساني، وتعنى بصحته، والإفراج عنه إن كان سجيناً، وبناء المساجد، ودعم الأسر ذات الدخل المحدود وأسر الأرامل والمطلقات، وتوفير السكن للمحتاجين من إيجار وأثاث وأجهزة وغيرها كثير.

مجتمع جميل، مجتمع يقوم على التكافل، والعمل الإنساني، ومساعدة المواطنين بدعمهم ليعتمدوا على أنفسهم عملاً وتعليماً تحت مظلة "باب رزق" وغيره من المؤسسات والشركات التابعة لعبد اللطيف جميل، خاصة أن أبناءه قد حذوا حذو والدهم، وتوسعوا في هذا الاتجاه ضمن الأهداف نفسها التي رسمها الوالد في خدمة الناس، ليكون ذلك شكراً منهم لله على توفيقه وإلهامه، وعلى قيادتنا في دعمها وتشجيعها لهم على هذه المبادرات.

Title: Dr Susan Hockfield
Content:
"Mohammed Jameel has an amazing ability to see the possibility for positive change before other people recognize it.  At MIT, we have benefitted enormously from this future-vision that he has.  Perhaps one of the best examples; Mohammed was among the first to understand the power of, what we now call, the Abdul Latif Jameel Poverty Action Lab (J-PAL).  He quickly appreciated J-PAL's model to understand and design viable routes out of poverty.  In Esther Duflo's parlance, 'he really got it',  that by careful analysis of interventions to alleviate poverty - with controlled studies - the impact of philanthropy to improve lives, could be maximized.

I still - so vividly -  recall my early meetings with Mohammed and how Esther Duflo's and Abhijit Banerjee's project to understand the causes and cures for poverty profoundly resonated with him. And what a fantastic tribute to their work, and his early support, that only about a decade later, the Nobel Prize Committee recognized the value of their work too.

On my first trip to Saudi Arabia, the first of many visits, I saw first hand the depth of Mohammed and Community Jameel's commitment to improving lives by tackling seemingly intractable problems.  Mohammed himself, took me on a tour of Bab Rizq Jameel - the incubator he and his family initiated in Jeddah.  Oh my!  Meeting those women, for whom Bab Rizq Jameel was creating jobs, creating entrepreneurs, and providing avenues for women to participate in the economy - I just can't describe how unforgettably moving that experience was.

And now I'm an advisor to the Jameel Clinic, and have the privilege of a front row seat on another far sighted ambition: to combine the power of computation and biomedical know-how to develop more accurate, more effective health care, for all populations, all over the world.  Already, the Jameel Clinic's work using artificial intelligence to identify a new class of antibiotics, and to make mammography more predictive, and much much more, is already changing the future of health care.

Mohammed really understands MIT's mission to bring our work to bear on the world's most daunting problems.  We meet that mission through science and engineering, and also through clear-eyed analysis of economics and politics.

What a wise and generous friend we have had in Mohammed and Community Jameel and what amazing work they've catalyzed and accelerated.

Mohammed, Community Jameel, congratulations of 75 years of generous, insightful, philanthropy, and thank you for improving the lives of so  any, today, and tomorrow."

Title: HRH Prince Sultan bin Salman bin Abdulaziz
Content:
"In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Peace, mercy and blessings of Allah be upon you.

I am pleased to participate in the 75th Anniversary of the birth of the Abdul Latif Jameel Company and Abdul Latif Jameel community programs that spread everywhere.  In fact, I bear witness to these blessed contributions by this Company, which has its roots mainly in a country known for its good and blessings.  Therefore, the business of this Company has grown into a well-known business.

That is why this Company and this kind family decided to give back and return the favor to the Saudi people in the form of these outstanding and prestigious initiative in all fields.  I witnessed many of the contributions and programs offered by Abdul Latif Jameel, with my brother Mohammed Abdul Latif Jameel, in every field, either charitable foundations for the special needs, the culture, the national heritage and even government institutions, which Abdul Latif Jameel has partnered with in supporting their programs and also the initiatives related to supporting the heritage of our dear country.

Title: Barbara Gunderson Stowe
Content:
"Greetings everyone!  It is a great honor for me to be part of this watershed celebration of the history of Abdul Latif Jameel and Community Jameel, and the vision and generosity of the Jameel family over 75 years.

I have known Mohammed for almost 30 of those 75 years.  Our paths first crossed at MIT where Mohammed received his undergraduate education, and where I worked for 25 years.

In my role at MIT, I had the good fortune to work with many philanthropists from around the world, and I can say without hesitation that the deep thinking and focused energy that Mohammed brings to understanding society's challenges, to exploring ways to address those challenges, and then identifying the best institutions and individuals, is second to none.  He does this with equal intensity and curiosity whether in the worlds of science, engineering, health, humanities, or the arts - all, with the goal of expanding opportunity and access to a wider population of people around the world.

Everyone who knows Mohammed well, hears him speak often of his father, and the ethos and values Abdul Latif Jameel brought to his business life and to his family.  And one can see and feel the ways in which Mohammed exemplifies those values and has passed them along to his four children.  As the Company and the family maintain that strong tradition of service and generosity over many years, I believe that Community Jameel serves as a model that has inspired other philanthropists across the global community and will continue to do so.

I'm always heartened when Mohammed says that he is in conversation with other philanthropic leaders around the world.  There is much to be learned - and emulated - as we endeavor, and sometimes struggle, to build a better and fairer world.

So, it is with deep and abiding respect and affection that I join with all of you in saluting Mohammed and the Jameel family, along with the team of colleagues they have built at Abdul Latif Jameel and Community Jameel.

Today, as we honor the legacy of the past, we look to the promise of the future.  I very much look forward to seeing the fruits of the laborers and generosity that we celebrate today continue and grow in the years ahead."

Title: Maria T Zuber
Content:
"So, I'd like to start by  talking a little bit about how I became acquainted with the Jameel family.  A number of years ago MIT's current president, then provost, Rafael Reif, asked myself and another faculty member to reach out to the MIT campus and to see what parts of environmental studies MIT wanted to amplify and wasn't involved with to the extent that they would really like to be.  And and we did that, and what came out of that was water and food that our faculty really viewed these areas as critical to the human condition and some work was going on but that that work could be amplified in an MIT way.  In ways that could help the world.  And Raphael introduced me to Mohammed Jameel and asked us to talk about that and Mohammed's reaction was: "well if we did a water and food center how many people do you think you could help?"  And I hadn't really thought about it, and I said well, I bet we could help thousands  - and and he seemed to like that answer.   And that led to the Abdul Latif Jameel Water and Food Systems laboratory (J-WAFS) at MIT.

And one of the first activities that that lab undertook was a study of  a dam in Ethiopia, close to the border of Egypt, and the director John Lienhard called together international experts to investigate the filling of the dam in a way that it wouldn't negatively impact inhabitants of the Nile to the north of the dam.  And that study was undertaken, it was given to the governments of Ethiopia and Egypt and one of the things that came out of the study is there are a hundred million people who get their water from the Nile in Egypt.  And then it impacted me that it was like. oh my god, you know we've we've done something that potentially positively influenced the lives of a hundred million people.

And it then struck me that this is the way that Mohammed Jameel thinks!  He thinks about impact and he thinks about improving the human condition on a large scale.

Working with the Jameel family has also been a very personal experience for me.  Our collaborations between MIT and Community Jameel have brought me to the Middle East on a number of occasions and I developed an interest in helping women from Saudi Arabia, and more broadly in the Middle East, mainly in the areas of enhanced educational opportunities for women and also how do we assimilate women into the workplace, so that they can help their families, and also help the economies in Saudi Arabia and the Middle East.  And I got a great deal of satisfaction out of my interactions in these activities and I don't think that I would have undertaken this if it hadn't been for my association with Community Jameel - and I am very grateful to them for that.

So, when I reflect on um the 75th anniversary of Community Jameel, I think a lot about how much this family has done for those in need.  Knowing the family, their dedication to their father Abdul Latif Jameel, their values, their compassion, but also their business sense and their drive.  It was really the perfect combination to help people and to associate with others who had similar interests.  You know, I often think that the most important people in the world to the Jameel family are those who have the greatest needs.  And the Jameel family, through Community Jameel, has delivered.  And I'd just like to take this opportunity to thank them for everything that they've done to allow MIT to help others in the world, and that they've done, you know, just for people everywhere.  It's been such an honor and a privilege to be associated with Community Jameel and I just look forward what we're all going to do collectively in the future."

Slider Quote: "Mohammed thinks about impact and he thinks about improving the human condition on a large scale"

Title: Prof. John H Lienhard V
Content:
Good morning.  I first met Mohammed Jameel in a phone call.  He got in touch with me to discuss some ideas we had developed at MIT about a water and food research program.  I laid my ideas before Mohammed, and he went off and thought about these and he was inspired!  And he came back and he asked MIT to create the Abdul Latif Jameel Water & Food Systems Lab (J-WAFS), which we did in 2014.

I'm privileged to direct that lab.  J-WAFS funds advanced research all over MIT directed at providing safe and stable supplies of water and food throughout the world to people at all levels of society and in many countries and places.  We have developed a number of remarkable scientific and technological ideas in the course of this.  We have created companies as a result of this.  And in my mind most importantly we have educated a legion of students who will go out and become future leaders in water and food research, multiplying our impact far beyond what we could accomplish at MIT by itself.

However, as I've learned more about Mohammed and the Jameel family, I've come to understand the full scale of their efforts to provide for the human race through advanced programs.  They've created the [Abdul Latif Jameel] Poverty Action Lab (J-PAL) at MIT, which uses blind studies to determine which interventions against poverty are effective and which are not, and they have had enormous reach around the world.

The Jameel family has created [the] Jameel Clinic (J-Clinic) which is marrying artificial intelligence in the practice of medicine to provide better diagnostics, and more rapid treatments for disease.   They've created the [Abdul Latif Jameel] World Education Lab (J-WEL), which is aiming to educate educators, so that they can return to their own universities and be more effective in their work.

And outside MIT they have created [the] Jameel Institute (J-IDEA),which is looking at infectious disease at Imperial College London.

However, the Jameel family also operates Community Jameel, which is a broad charity reaching out across the Middle Eastern Region - they do jobs creation, and other forms of outreach touching the lives of many many thousands of people, across that region and elsewhere.

The Jameel family has also made major commitments to the arts: they've they've created a beautiful gallery at the Victoria & Albert museum, with stunning artifacts from Islamic art.  They have also created - very special in my mind - the Jameel Art Center in Dubai, which is reaching out into the community to bring them in contact with contemporary art.  It's not simply 'art on display' to come observe but it's actually community interaction and teaching and programs for children; as well as nurturing of local artists who are specializing around the region.

For all of this I think I can only say thank you to the Jameel family for their generosity and their concern for the well-being of everyone.

We all owe them a great debt for their contributions to making a better world and I hope to see what comes in the future, and where this may continue to blossom and develop.

Thank you.

Abdul Latif Jameel Professor of Water & Mechanical Engineering
Director, Abdul Latif Jameel Water & Food Systems Lab (J-WAFS) at MIT

Title: HRH Prince Turki bin Faisal bin Abdulaziz Al Saud
Content:
A pioneering model in social responsibility: Community Jameel.

We, the people of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, the government and the people, are proud of the legacy rooted in our religion, culture, history and the nature of our society, which is the supremacy of doing good and raising the status of the philanthropist because of the human values embodied by good deeds and the achievement of the ideals of society in the field of solidarity and compassion. Community Jameel Foundation is an organization that deserves to be cherished because of the deeply rooted values it embodies in our society.

When the late Sheikh Abdul Latif Jameel is mentioned, he is not only mentioned for his success as a great businessman, but more for his social initiatives and his charitable and generous works that have not ceased over the past seventy-five years in his life, and after his death (may Allah rest his soul in peace), thanks to the continuation of his work through his sons and daughters.

This honorable history constitutes a model for the meaning and importance of ‘social responsibility’ for the private sector, which I hope will be a tradition for all private sector institutions and companies in our country; especially those that are able to follow this model to serve our society and contribute to its sustainable development and consolidate the principle of social responsibility for capital and the owners of this money.

Community Jameel's initiatives and programs aiming at creating job opportunities for youth and the interest in innovation, entrepreneurship and creativity are an actual and tangible contribution to our national march towards the future.

 

HRH Prince Turki bin Faisal bin Abdulaziz Al Saud is Chairman of King Faisal Foundation's Center for Research and Islamic Studies.

 

 

نموذج رائد في المسؤولية المجتمعية:

مجتمع جميل

نعتز ونفتخر نحن أبناء المملكة العربية السعودية، حكومة وشعباً، بأرث متجذر في ديننا وثقافتنا وتاريخنا وفي طبيعة مجتمعنا، إلا وهو سمو فعل الخير والرفع من شأن فاعله لما يجسده عمل الخير من قيم إنسانية ومن تحقيق للمثل العليا للمجتمع في مجال التكافل والتراحم. ومشروع مؤسسة مجتمع جميل مشروع يستحق أن يكون محل اعتزازنا لما يجسده من قيم راسخة في مجتمعنا.

حينما يأتي ذكر المغفور له بإذن الله الشيخ عبداللطيف جميل، لا يذكر نجاحه كرجل أعمال ورأسمالي كبير فقط بل بما أسس له من مبادرات اجتماعية وما قدمه من أعمال خيرية وعطاء لم ينقطع طيلة الخمسة وسبعين عاماً الماضية في حياته وفي ما بعد وفاته (رحمه الله) وذلك بفضل استدامة عمله من خلال أبنائه وبناته الكرام.

يشكل هذا التاريخ المشرف نموذجاً لمعنى وأهمية المسؤولية الاجتماعية للقطاع الخاص، والذي اتمنى أن يكون تقليداً لكل مؤسسات وشركات القطاع الخاص في بلادنا، لا سيما تلك القادرة على اتباع هذا النموذج خدمة لمجتمعنا ومساهمة في تنميته المستدامة وترسيخاً لمبدأ المسؤولية الاجتماعية لرأس المال وأصحاب هذا المال.

إن ما تقوم به مؤسسة مجتمع جميل من مبادرات ومشاريع بهدف ايجاد فرص العمل للشباب والاهتمام بالابتكار وريادة الأعمال والإبداع هي مساهمة فعلية وملموسة في مسيرتنا الوطنية نحو المستقبل. فمشروع رزق جميل بشركاته ومؤسساته 

في هذه المجالات خدم الأف الشباب ووفر لهم فرص حقيقية لينجحوا في حياتهم ويطمئنوا على مستقبلهم. وفي السياق نفسه ينبغي الأشادة الدائمة بدور هذه المؤسسة في رعاية الأيتام وتعليمهم 

وتدريبهم وتؤظيفهم، وفي رعاية المرضى والمساجين ورعاية الأسر المنتجة وفي مكافحة الفقر.

وبالرغم من التكريم الذي نالته هذه المؤسسة الرائدة ورجالها عبر تاريخها من دول عديدة إلا أن أكبر تكريم يعترف بهذه الانجازات في وطنها هو تكريم المغفور له بإذن الله خادم الحرمين الشريفين الملك عبد الله بن عبدالعزيز

 ل

هذه المؤسسة الرائدة ممثلة برئيس برامج عبداللطيف جميل لخدمة المجتمع الأستاذ محمد عبداللطيف جميل، تقديراً لدورها الاجتماعي والخيري وذلك بمنحها وسام الملك عبدالعزيز من الدرجة الأولى، وهو أرفع وسام في المملكة العربية السعودية.

ارجو لهذه المؤسسة الرائدة استمرارها في مبادراتها الوطنية والدولية، ولتبقى نموذجاً في العمل الاجتماعي والخيري في بلادنا وفي العالم.

 

                                                                 صاحب السمو الملكي

الأمير تركي الفيصل بن عبدالعزيز

Title: Mr. Ibrahim Abdulrahman Al-Belaihi
Content:
An Open-Handed Company

I grew up with a passion for tracking human phenomena of all kinds; whether at the local, Arab level, Islamic, or even the global humanitarian level.  Driven by this overwhelming interest, I was keen on following, acquiring and reading thousands of translated books of different languages around the globe.  Not satisfied with only that, I also allocated thematically classified files for this purpose.  In doing so, it kept much of content published in the newspapers on the various aspects of the human being: the pros and cons; the atrocities of the world, and the great human aspects against evils.  Among the press reports I kept was press coverage on generous donations, humanitarian organizations, and charitable endowments in the United States of America.  The title of the press report was (Openhanded America), from which I quoted the title of this article.  I was used to tracing the donations of businessmen in different countries of the world.  For me, it felt very indignant that the wealthy Arabs do not have similar contributions, as the wealthy in America do.  Even the Rockefellers, whom some have attacked, made important contributions to the service of the American people.  We also find that the most prestigious American universities such as Harvard University, as well as the greatest and most famous hospitals; Like Mayo Clinic, were commenced as a charity.

Donations in the USA cover various fields, including founding universities, hospitals and multi-purpose scientific foundations.  The English scientist James Smithson donated all of his money to establish 'Smithsonian Institute' which aims at development and spreading knowledge in Washington, USA.  This charitable scientific project was established on a vast land that features museums and a scientific research institute.

In his book 'Screw It, Let's Do It: Lessons In Life' to the author Richard Branson, who is also a famous businessman, said: “It’s said that money is the root of all evil.  It doesn’t have to be.  Money can be used for good.  The biggest charities in the world were started by rich men and women, but some were begun with next to nothing.  Harvard, the wealthiest college in America, is a charitable trust.  IKEA is a charitable trust Big Mac gives USD 50 million a year to charity.  In the USA, a huge society was founded under the name of 'The Giving Pledge' that includes all wealthiest people in the USA and it was the beginning for huge donations."

I happened to read that the world is home to about one hundred and thirty-eight thousand non-governmental charitable organizations, together employing two million permanent employees, with nearly 12 million volunteers.  Those organizations spend one hundred and twelve billion dollars in favor of the needy people in all different parts of the world.  In fact, the donations made by Bill Gates, Buffett, Zuckerberg and others, are not only generous but also huge.  They give the finest examples for the generous wealthy people.

However, generous denotations in the USA and all over the world aren’t limited to the companies or the wealthy businessmen.  Among my archives, I found a press report titled: 'In combating dearth in needy countries, peasants in Canada donate part of their crops'.  Further, I got another press report confirms that 'many foundations in the different parts of the USA are to allocate their charitable donations to children'.  The report added: 'there is a remarkable interest in children, particularly the projects supporting their education'.  Along the same lines, the Red Cross, Doctors without Borders and other humanitarian organizations were founded.

Over the past years, while I was reflecting on and rejoicing over these marvelous works, I was carrying the feelings of blame for the wealthy Arabs, many of whom were probably stingy even to pay the Zakat.  I was hunger for any news about any example of giving from local or Arab companies with huge resources.  Finally, I saw a flash, even a luminous torch spreading light in various directions.  Tracking the light, it was emanating from Abdul Latif Jameel Company , a generous organization with various effect-lasting contributions.  Most notably to know, Abdul Latif Jameel manages its charitable contributions with adequacy, accuracy and diligence.  In its contributions, it seeks the most beneficial aspect, with the most lasting benefit.  It does not give the needy meals, but it opens permanent doors for livelihood.  It does not give the hungry a fish to eat and then starve after hours.  But, as the famous proverb says, it teaches him fishing, so he secures his needs regularly, and sells to others what he catches, thus getting rid of poverty, and contributing to work and production.

In their book 'Corporate Social Responsibility', the two authors, Philip Kotler and Nancy Lee, state that: “Each dollar matters when it comes to funding schools'; therefore, Abdul Latif Jameel paid great attention to education, training and raising the awareness of the boys and girls to the promising sectors.

The Top Man in Abdul Latif Jameel, Eng. Mohammed Abdul Latif Jameel, is not only the managing leader, but also a man of culture, knowledge, thought, and highly diversified interests.  During my meeting with him and in the course of my communications and conversations with him, his patriotic enthusiasm was extremely glowing.  He has high keenness on developing his nation and securing its stability, derived by his loyalty to the political leadership.  He follows, hears, reads and discusses.  He always seeks to catch any national pulse that could be a spark for cooperation for the sake of national interest.  Despite being occupied by business, his wealth, social position and his lack of interest for someone like me, yet, I was surprised to receive his call and without any previous communication.  He said that he follows my intellectual activity and wishes to meet me in person.  We have agreed to the appointment and he honored me with his visit to my home in Riyadh.  During the meeting, he affirmed that he has this powerful passion to spread the enlightening notions within/outside the Saudi Arabian community.  Indeed, he doesn’t expect any personal benefit from an author like me, but this is part of his interest in the public domain.

Maybe what makes Eng. Mohammed Abdul Latif Jameel stand out among his counterparts is, I think, his outstanding interest in the national affairs, his keenness on serving people and his strong presence in the public domain.  He started many programs that care for different categories, and his national, social and cultural interests were unprecedentedly varied in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia.  He is worthy of the Order of King Abdulaziz – First Class.  And with his activity extended to the International arena; he was awarded the rank of Knight Commander (KBE), not to mention the so many awards and honors he received from various international cultural and scientific foundations. He is so enthusiastic when he speaks about the homeland, he reflects a rare sense of patriotism. 

Without delving into any details regarding the contributions of the Company on the national, Arab and International levels, it might be sufficient to refer to the headlines of the fields where the company provides great social and humanitarian contributions.

Abdul Latif Jameel, through Community Jameel, contributed in several developmental aspects, most notably:

First: Job Creation

Launching Bab Rizq Jameel—or ‘beautiful gateway to prosperity’, which contributes in creating jobs for the youth in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia through:

  • Recruitment
  • Training
  • Funding the small projects and productive families

Since its establishment 18 years earlier, Bab Rizq Jameel contributed to provide 700 thousand employment opportunities.

Second: Arts

Through Art Jameel and its affiliated centers that spread in Jeddah and Dubai, Community Jameel supports artists and provides training on heritage and traditional arts, in addition to preserving the artifacts by launching the first open museum in Jeddah.  

Third: Health

Establishing the first hospital to provide care for the people of special needs (Abdul Latif Jameel Hospital in Jeddah), and co-founding King Salman Centre for Disability Research in Riyadh.

It was also a co-founder of many international scientific centers such as Jameel Clinic in MIT, and the Abdul Latif Jameel Institute for Disease and Emergency Analytics (J-IDEA).

Fourth: Development

The achievements include:

  • Abdul Latif Jameel Poverty Action Lab (J-PAL) in MIT, whose co-founders received Nobel Peace Prize in 2019.
  • Abdul Latif Jameel Water and Food Systems Lab (J-WAFS), MIT University.

Fifth: Education

Founding at MIT the Abdul Latif Jameel World Education Lab (J-WEL)

And Tanweer Jameel program for orphans

Indeed, each of the aforementioned titles involves great achievements, and various facilities.  The businessmen, in various fields, have a great role in providing services, in the prosperity of communities, and in the cultural progress.  It would be enough to mention the great contributions of Ferdinand de Lesseps, Thomas Edison, Henry Ford, Andrew Carnegie, John D. Rockefeller, J. P. Morgan, Walt Disney, the pioneer of oil exploration in the USA “Drake”, Bill Gates, Steve Jobs and Elon Musk.

 

Ibrahim Al Belaihi

شركة معطاءة

نشأتُ مهتمًّا؛ بتتبُّع الظواهر البشرية من كافة الجوانب؛ سواء على المستوى المحلي، أو المستوى العربي، أو المستوى الاسلامي، أو المستوى الإنساني العالمي؛ وبدافعٍ من هذا الاهتمام المستحوذ؛ كنتُ أحرص على تتبع واقتناء وقراءة آلاف الكتب المترجَمة من مختلف لغات العالم. لكنني لم أكتف بذلك بل فتحتُ لهذا الغرض؛ ملفات موزَّعة موضوعيًّا؛ وبذلك احتفظتُ بالكثير مما تنشرها لصحف؛ عن مختلف الجوانب البشرية: الايجابيات والسلبيات؛ عن فظائع العالم، وعن الجوانب الانسانية العظيمة؛ المضادةَّ للشرور. ومن بين التقارير الصحفية التي احتفظت بها؛ تغطية صحفية؛ عن التبرعات السخية والجمعيات الانسانية، والأوقاف الخيرية في الولايات المتحدة الأمريكية؛ وكان عنوان التقرير الصحفي (أمريكا المعطاءة) ومنه اقتبستُ عنوان هذه الكلمة. وكنت أتابع تبرعات رجال الأعمال في مختلف بلدان العالم؛ فأشعر بالامتعاض الشديد على أن الأثرياء العرب؛ ليست لهم إسهامات مماثلة. حيث نجد أن الأثرياء في أمريكا لهم إسهامات عظيمة، حتى روكفلر الذي هاجمه البعض؛ هو الآخر له إسهامات مهمة في خدمة الشعب الأمريكي. كما نجد أن أعرق الجامعات الأمريكية مثل جامعة هارفارد؛ وكذلك أعظم وأشهر المشافي؛ مثل مايو اكلنك؛ كان عملاًّ خيريًّا....

​         وتغطي التبرعاتُ في أمريكا مختلف المجالات؛ فهذا يقيم جامعة، وآخر يقيم مشفى، وثالث ينشئ مؤسسة علمية متعددة الأغراض؛ فالعالم الإنجليزي جيمس سميشون تبرع بكل أمواله لينشئ في واشنطن بالولايات المتحدة الأمريكية: (معهد سميشون : مؤسسة للتنمية ونشر المعرفة) لقد أقيم هذا المشروع العلمي الخيري على مساحة واسعة؛ تضم متاحف ومعهد الأبحاث العلمية ... 

​         في كتابه (الاقتحام) يقول المؤلف رتشارد برانسون وهو رجل أعمال شهير: ((يقال إن المال رأس كل علة. ليس لزامًا أن يكون كذلك؛ إذْ يمكن استخدامه من أجل فعل الخير. لق أسَّس أكبرَ الجمعيات الخيرية في العالم؛ رجالٌ ونساءٌ أثرياء؛ هارفارد أغنى جامعة في أمريكا؛ هي وقفٌ خيري. شركة إيكيا هي وقفٌ خيري. بق ماك؛ مؤسس ماكدونالد تقدم شركته الآن مبلغ خمسين مليون دولار سنويا)) وفي الولايات المتحدة الأمريكية تم تأسيس جمعية ضخمة باسم (وعدٌ وعطاءٌ) تضم كبار الأثرياء الأمريكيين وقد كانت البداية تبرعات ضخمة للغاية ...

​         وقد قرأتُ بأنه يوجد هناك مائة وثمانية وثلاثون ألف مؤسسة أهلية خيرية؛ يعمل فيها مليونان من الموظفين الدائمين، يساعدهم (12) اثنى عشر مليون موظف متطوع، وتنُفق هذه المؤسسات الخيرية سنويًّا مائةً واثني عشر مليار دولار يتم إنفاقها على المحتاجين في مختلف أقطار العالم. إن تبرعات بيل جيتس، وبافيت، وزكيربيرج وغيرهم؛ هي تبرعات لا توصف فقط بأنها سخية للغاية بل إنها تبرعات هائلة، وتعُطي أمثلة رائعة لأثرياء الكرماء الأسخياء...

​         وليست التبرعات السخية في أمريكا وفي العالم؛ محصورة بالشركات، أو برجال الأعمال الأثرياء؛ ولكني أجد بين القصاصات؛ تقريراً صحفيًّا يقول: (لمكافحة المجاعة في الدول المحتاجة؛ الفلاحون في كندا؛ يتصدقون بجزء من محاصيلهم)) وأجد تقريراً صحفيًّا آخر يؤكد: ((أن الكثير من المؤسسات في مختلف أنحاء الولايات المتحدة الأمريكية؛ تتجه نحو تخصيص مساعداتها في مجال العمل الخيري للأطفال. ويضيف: ((يوجد اهتمامٌ ملحوظ بالصغار، وخصوصًا بالمشروعات ذات الصلة بتعليمهم)) وفي نفس الاتجاه؛ انُشئتْ منظمةُ الصليب الأحمر، ومنظمة أطباء بلا حدود وغيرها من المنظمات الإنسانية ...   

وخلال السنوات الماضية؛ بينما كنت أتأمل ذلك، وأبتهج به، وألوم الأثرياء العرب الذين ربما بخل الكثيرون منهم؛ حتى بإخراج الزكاة الواجبة. كنتُ أتصيّد أي خبر عن أي نموذج معطاء من الشركات المحلية أو العربية ذات الموارد الضخمة؛ أبصرت وميضًا بل وهَجًا مضيئاً؛ ينشر الضياء في مختلف الاتجاهات؛ ينبعث من شركة عبد اللطيف جميل المعطاءة؛ فالشركة تُقدّم عطاءاتٍ متنوعة ذات تأثير دائم، ومن الأهم أيضا الإشارة إلى أن شركة عبد اللطيف جميل، تدير إسهاماتها الخيرية بكفاية ودقة وعناية، إنها في إسهاماتها؛ تتحرى الأكثر نفعًا، والأدْوَم عطاءً؛ وكما في المثل؛ فإنها لا تعُطي المحتاجين وجبات غذائية، ولكنها تفتح لهم أبوابًا دائمة للرزق؛ فإنها لا تعطي الجائع سمكة يأكلها ثم يجوع بعد ساعات؛ ولكنها تعلمه كيف يصطاد هو السمك، فيتغذى هو بانتظام، ويبيع للآخرين مايصطاده، فيغتني عن الفقر، ويسُهم في العمل والانتاج ...

في كتاب (المسؤولية الاجتماعية للشركات) ينبه المؤلفان فيليب كوتلر ونانسي لي بأن: ((لكل دولار قيمة وأهمية؛ عندما يتعلق الإمر بتمويل المدارس)) لذلك اهتمت شركة عبد اللطيف جميل بالتعليم والتدريب وتوعية الفتيان والفتيات إلى المجالات الواعدة ...   

إن الرجل الأول في الشركة المهندس محمد عبد اللطيف جميل؛ ليس رجلَ إدارةٍ فقط، وإنما هو رجل ثقافة، ومعرفة، وفكر، واهتمامات متنوعة عالية. لقد لاحظت أثناء لقائي به وخلال التواصل معه، ومن أحاديثه، واهتماماته، وتواصُله، وإلحاحه الشديد على الهمِّ الوطني؛ أنه يتأجَّج حبّاً للوطن، ورغبةً في نمائه، وحرصًا على تطوره واستقراره، وإخلاصًا للقيادة السياسية. إنه يتابع، ويسمع، ويقرأ، ويناقش ويحاور. كما أنه يحاول أن يَتعرّف على أي نبضٍ وطني يستشعر فيه إمكانية التعاون من أجل المصلحة الوطنية؛ فرغم انشغاله، وثرائه، ومكانته الاجتماعية، واستغنائه عن أي فرد من أمثالي؛ إلا أنني قبل سنوات؛ ومن دون أي تعارف سابق؛ فوجئتُ به يتصل من جدة، يخبرني بأنه قد تابع نشاطي الفكري، وأنه يرغب في أن نلتقي، فاتفقنا على الموعد وزارني في بيتي في الرياض، وأثناء اللقاء أكّد رغبته القوية في نشر الأفكار التنويرية داخل المجتمع السعودي وخارجه. وبالطبع فهو لا يتوقع من كاتب مثلي أيّ نفع شخصي ولكن ذلك جزءٌ من اهتمامه بالشأن العام ...  

إن المهندس محمد عبد اللطيف جميل، الذي تميّز من بين رجال الأعمال بأنه؛ الأشد اهتمامًا بالشأن الوطني، وعنايةً بخدمة الناس، والأكثر حضوراً في الهم العام، فقد أنشأ العديد من البرامج التي تعُنى بمختلف الفئات؛ كما تنوعت اهتماماته الوطنية، والاجتماعية، والثقافية، بشكل غير مسبوق في المملكة؛ فاستحق بجدارة، وسام الملك عبد العزيز من الدرجة الأولى، وامتد نشاطه إلى الإسهام على المستوى العالمي فنال رتبة فارس في بريطانيا، كما تلقى احتفاءً، وجوائز، وتكريمًا، من مؤسسات ثقافية، وعلمية، عالمية، إنه حين يتحدث عن الوطن يتقد حماسًا يُعَبِّر عن وطنية ٍنادرة...

ومن دون الدخول في أي تفاصيل عن إسهامات الشركة الخيرية على المستوى الوطني والمستوى العربي والمستوى العالمي؛ يكفي أن أشير إلى العناوين الرئيسية للمجالات التي تقدِّم الشركة فيها إسهامات اجتماعية وإنسانية عظيمة ...

إن شركة عبد اللطيف جميل؛ ساهمت من خلال مؤسسة مجتمع جميل في العديد من المجلات التنموية ويأتي في مقدمة تلك المساهمات:

أولا: مجال خلق فرص العمل.

تأسيس ( باب رزق جميل ) والذي يساهم؛ في خلقِ فرصِ عملٍ لشباب وشابات الوطن عبر ما يلي :

-   التوظيف

-   التدريب

-   تمويل المشاريع الصغيرة والأسر المنتجة.

وقد بلغ عدد فرص العمل التي ساعد باب رزق جميل في توفيرها منذ بداية نشاطه قبل حوالي 18 عاما أكثر من 700 الف فرصة عمل.

ثانيا: المجال الفنّي. وذلك من خلال تأسيس الفن جميل ومراكزه المنتشرة في كل من جدة ودبي إضافة الى التدريب على الفنون التراثية والمحافظة على المجسمات الجمالية من خلال تأسيس اول متحف مفتوح بمدينة جدة.

ثالثا: المجال الصحي.

تأسيس اول مستشفى لرعاية ذوي الاحتياجات الخاصة (مستشفى عبد اللطيف جميل للتأهيل والرعاية). والمساهمة في مركز الملك سلمان لأبحاث الإعاقة. إضافة الى المراكز البحثية العلمية الدولية مثل عيادة جميل في جامعة ام اي تي وايضا معمل عبد اللطيف جميل في امبريال كوليج. 

رابعا: مجلات التنمية.

مثل:

*   معمل عبد اللطيف جميل لمكافحة الفقر في ام اي تي والذي حصل مؤسسوه على جائزة نوبل للسلام في عام 2019.

*   معمل عبد اللطيف جميل للأمن الغذائي والمائي بجامعة ام اي تي.

خامسا: مجال التعليم.

من خلال تأسيس معمل عبد اللطيف جميل لتطوير التعليم العالمي بجامعة ام اي تي وبرنامج تنوير للأيتام.

إن كل عنوان من هذه العناوين ينطوي على إنجازات كبيرة، وتسهيلات متنوعة. إن رجال الأعمال؛ في مختلف المجالات؛ لهم إسهامات عظيمة؛ في توفير الخدمات، وفي ازدهار المجتمعات، وفي تقدم الحضارة، ويكفي أن نتذكر الإسهامات العظيمة بل الحاسمة؛ لفرديناند دي ليسبس وتوماس إديسون، وهنري فورد، وأندروكارنجي، وجون روكفلر، وجون مورجان، ووالت ديزني، ورائد التنقيب عن النفط في أمريكا درايك، وبيل جيتس، وستيف جوبز، وإيلون ماسك. 

إبراهيم البليهي

Title: Sanjay E. Sarma
Content:
I could wish Community Jameel, [congratulations] on its 75th anniversary  -  and I do wholeheartedly - but I wish for the World another 75 years of Community Jameel and the spirit of Community Jameel, because the world needs it.

You know, MJ [Mohammed Jameel] has been someone who has taken on the topics that others won't fund despite being fundamental to the future of our planet.  Poverty: which corporation cares for poverty, a few foundations do, but for Mohammed to create J-PAL, takes vision and a certain courage, and a certain amount of gravitas to say: 'we will take it on, and we will make a difference.'

Water and food security: again, water is everywhere and it's soon going to be in short supply, and yet MJ thinks and recognizes it's fundamental.  Education: education is a little bit orphaned.  And the future of education, rethinking education, this is something we have to do as countries around the world start . . .  their economies start reshaping and education becomes important.  And Mohammed comes and says: 'let's take it on', right . . .   So, his generosity is such that it empowers MIT, and the other entities that Community Jameel has funded to take on problems that others won't.  And that to me is. very special, liberating, inspiring, and for many of us it's been a life-changing thing because we've gotten into these fields because of MJ.

Even before COVID-19  struck, it was clear that education was going to have to reshape itself. COVID of course, has brought into stark focus.  The [Abdul Latif] Jameel World Education Lab (J-WEL) looks at education and reconstitutes it in ways that are more efficacious, more effective, more affordable, more impactful on students.  Whether it's, you know, the science of learning, or the practice of teaching, or labs, or the training of teachers.  All aspects of that, the leadership of universities at three different levels: one is the K-12 level, the second is in 'higher ed.' and the third is in the adult education, that is people in the workforce.   It looks at creating new scenarios for education such that we can make a direct impact on people's lives and on economies.  And it's a consortium and we have dozens of companies, countries, regions, universities, schools, working together to share best practices and to learn from each other, and also to bring together the best expertise MIT and our ecosystem has, to look at the future of education.

Now this was all important even before COVID but COVID has put it in sharp contrast.  The urgent need for rethinking education and J-WEL has put us in a very good place now, in the post COVID era, to take on this incredible challenge that humanity faces.

You know, all the centers at MIT carry the name of the patriarch of the Jameel family: Abdul Latif Jameel.  I have not had the pleasure of meeting him, obviously, but he is clearly a man who created both an extraordinary industry, but also launched a family of public servants -  people who really care about humanity.  Of course I've already talked about Mohammed.

Fady Jameel is the person who actually signed and attended the inauguration of the Jameel World Education Lab.  He is someone deeply interested in art and in the humanities.

Hassan Jameel is very interested in refugees in the education space and also in technology.  Hassan and I . . .   Hassan invited me actually to an event in Jordan where he led a very passionate discussion of the plight of refugees and how education could help with Queen Rania and others dominaries from around the Middle East present.  And it so it is clearly a family that cares deeply.   It's not just one generation it's three generations clearly.  And then there's the extended family - whether it's Amna or George Richards - of people who carry this spirit forward.

So, to me Community Jameel is truly a community.  It's it's an extended family of caring individuals who have been passionate about topics, about issues that matter to the world.

Title: Waleed Al-Ibrahim
Content:
Walt Disney said: 'If you can dream it, you can do it.'  When I remember this saying, I recall the many of the early innovators who followed the path of success with steady and confident steps, in a sea of ​​challenges and changes, then attained what they dreamed of, and accomplished what they worked for.

Perhaps the most prominent of these is Abdul Latif Jameel may Allah rest his soul, the founding father of the pioneering company that is capably managed today by my brother Mohammad Abdul Latif Jameel, to whom I give my heartfelt congratulations on the occasion of the 75th anniversary of the Company's establishment.

In this occasion I would like to point out that pioneering initiatives and successful businesses cannot thrive or bear fruit, or have real value unless it is coupled with a human aspect that is based on giving and commitment to community concerns (institutions and individuals) through social service in its various forms, and the innovative initiatives of sustainable results.  In practice, such initiatives are indispensable for building a comprehensive community ecosystem that is based on  empowering human being and enhancing his competitiveness being the most important human capital and the most valuable asset in our life.

The goal remains to convey the bright image of the talented, innovative and creative Saudi citizen to the region and the world.  From here, I would like to commend Abdul Latif Jameel's community initiatives for 75 years of dedication and giving, most notably Community Jameel and Bab Rizq Jameel and many others.  Those initiatives have indeed contributed to the creation of tens of thousands of job opportunities for young men and women in our beloved country Saudi Arabia.  They also help to hone skills, training and link higher education with the labor market opportunities and requirements.

In conclusion, I would like to say to my brother Mohammed Abdul Latif Jameel and his team spread over the five continents I am confident that the next 75 years will bear many initiatives and successes more than what we have witnessed in past years, Inshallah.

[Translated from Arabic]

Learn more about our contributor here and here.

 

يقول والت ديزني:  "إذا كنت تستطيع أن تحلم به، إذا يمكنك تحقيقه". عندما أتذكر هذا القول تحضرني صور العديد من الأوائل المبدعين الذين ساروا على درب النجاح بخطوات ثابتة وواثقة، في بحر من التحديات والمتغيرات فحققوا ما حلموا به وأنجزوا ما عملوا لأجله، ولعل أبرز هؤلاء عبد اللطيف جميل طيب الله ثراه الأب المؤسس للشركة الرائدة التي يديرها اليوم باقتدار أخي محمد عبد اللطيف جميل الذي أتوجه إليه بالتهنئة القلبية بمناسبة مرور 75 عام على التأسيس.

في هذه المناسبة أود أن أشير إلى أن المبادرات الرائدة والأعمال الناجحة لا يمكن أن تزدهر أو تثمر أو أن يكون لها قيمة حقيقية إلا إذا اقترنت بجانب إنساني أساسه العطاء والالتزام بقضايا المجتمع (مؤسسات وأفراد) وذلك عبر الخدمة الاجتماعية بمختلف أشكالها وبالمبادرات المبتكرة ذات النتائج المستدامة، عملياً لا غنى عن مثل هذه المبادرات لبناء منظومة مجتمعية كاملة متكاملة قوامها تمكين الإنسان وتعزيز قدراته التنافسية كونه رأس المال البشري الأهم والأثمن في حياتنا ويبقى الهدف إيصال الصورة المشرقة إلى المواطن السعودي الموهوب والمبتكر والمبدع إلى المنطقة والعالم.

من هنا أود أن أثني على مبادرات شركة عبد اللطيف جميل المجتمعية طوال 75 عام من التفاني والعطاء وأبرزها مجتمع جميل وباب رزق جميل وغيرها الكثير، هي التي ساهمت وتسهم في إيجاد عشرات الآلاف من فرص العمل للشباب والشابات في وطننا الحبيب المملكة العربية السعودية كما تساعد على صقل المهارات والتدريب وربط التعليم العالي بفرص سوق العمل ومتطلباته.

ختاماً أقول لأخي محمد عبد اللطيف جميل وفريق عمله المنتشر في القارات الخمس أنا على ثقة بأن الـ 75 سنة المقبلة تحمل من المبادرات والنجاحات أكثر مما حملته السنوات الماضية إن شاء الله.

Title: Nadhmi Al-Nasr
Content:
Dear Mohammed,

Allow me to extend my heartfelt congratulations on the celebration of Abdul Latif Jameel’s 75th anniversary. It is a truly remarkable achievement.

It has been inspiring to witness the journey of Abdul Latif Jameel and see the contributions made, not only to the citizens of Saudi Arabia, but well beyond our borders.

From being an economic driver for the Kingdom and the region, creating jobs for our citizens, initiatives that address some the world’s most pressing challenges, all the way through to your support of Arabic arts and culture, your kindness has enriched society on so many levels.

Through your determination, partnerships, desire for excellence and philanthropy, you have become a revered cultural ambassador for Saudi Arabia. A true role model, it is through the ambition and vision of leaders like you that we have belief of a future rich in opportunity with human progress and the common good at its heart.

On behalf of the entire NEOM team, we wish you continued success in the incredible work that you do.


Yours sincerely,

 

Nadhmi Al-Nasr
Chief Executive Officer
NEOM

Abdul Latif Jameel is one of the most important Saudi commercial organizations that has been keen to consolidate the concept of social responsibility in the private sector.  It has been always a distinguished role model for private businesses in launching and supporting many community initiatives, including qualification and training, employment, health, scientific research, culture and arts, and the revival of traditional crafts.

Community Jameel’s initiatives have been pioneering in creating effective partnerships between the Saudi government sector and civil organizations.  It also contributed to providing innovative solutions with a focus on development programs and promoting individual capabilities, in addition to its leading partnerships with Saudi and international universities to serve scientific research.

As for Bab Rizq Jameel, an initiative of Community Jameel that was launched in Saudi Arabia, it is very close to myself for two reasons: it was one of the charitable causes that captured the interest of my father, King Abdullah bin Abdulaziz, and he used to praise it in many of our family gatherings, for being focusing on qualifying women and empowering them economically.  The second reason is that I have touched a personality through my visit to their centers, how Bab Rizq Jameel contributed to improving the lives of women who benefited from it and supported them in leading a decent life that every woman diligently pursues to improve her financial and social position.

Abdul Latif Jameel has formed a global Saudi model that demonstrates the importance of private sector’s role in serving society, and has achieved the equation of excellence in global business and charitable initiatives in various fields and in many countries.

Entrepreneurship and service of humanity is a lofty mission that was initiated by the late Sheikh Abdul Latif Jameel, whose vision and approach are still continuing and developing by his son, Mr. Mohammed Jameel, may Allah bless his generous efforts and commendable strides for the good of mankind.

HRH Princess Adela bint Abdullah bin Abdulaziz

Chairwoman of multiple Saudi charitable societies

Title: Majed Al Hogail

The good thing is that all business sectors have also realized that social responsibility is not just a charitable activity to be carried out during a limited period of time and then ends, but to the contrary it is a sustainable activity and a key part of the activities of various companies and establishments of different types.

In the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, specifically, the concept of social responsibility is an integral part of the structure of private sector entities of all kinds.

These efforts  are also promoted and supported by the government agencies that have enabled the private sector to do its part, by providing the companies and establishments with all facilities to launch social programs and initiatives marked by a critical component which is sustainability.

Title: Uzma Sulaiman
Content:
My name is Uzma Sulaiman.  I'm the Associate Director of Partnerships at Community Jameel.  I'm incredibly proud to work at Community Jameel,  specifically because of the values that the organization has and I think this is very much testament to the Family and the values that they've instilled within the organization.  There's a strong sense of creativity and collaboration that exists and this is coupled with an incredibly strong work ethic, a sense of humility and also a sense of daring, into what Community Jameel can achieve.  I think those values are very important and it's one of the reasons that I'm very proud to be part of Community Jameel.

I've only been working at Community Jameel for a relatively short amount of time.  I have a background in international development and I've always been very much aware of Community Jameel, as have my colleagues, and when we had the opportunity to work with Community Jameel we didn't know what to expect and we were so impressed by the innovative approach to programing.  And now that I've worked for Community Jameel I'm so proud to be accepted into this into this Family into this team.

The first person in the Family that I met was Hassan.  And, we were about to go into a meeting in Jordan and I was terrified because I didn't know what to expect and I obviously wanted to make a really good impression.  And I went in, and he was so incredibly kind and so professional.  He always referred to me and always brought me into the conversation.  He was just always aware of the people that surrounded him and it was that sense of compassion.  And again it's kind of instilled into Community Jameel and the way that we conduct our programing, the kind of awareness and the consideration to the community.

Even in our scholarship programs at the Royal College of Music and MIT, the Family are always concerned about the students. They're always asking about them and  they're always asking for us to find any opportunity to promote the students.  It really is just a genuine sense of caring about about people.

So, a lot of organizations they would look at the world look at the problems and they would say 'okay that is unsolvable we won't be able to tackle that one' and that is the complete opposite way of working at Community Jameel - l the harder the better!  They'll watch a documentary, they'll read a newspaper article and it'll be 'oh this is the problem that nobody's been able to to crack' and that, it's really inspiring because when you first get you're like oh this seems too complicated and then the way that, again, they're able to ,like you know, dissect that information, the way that they're able to corral this international efforts of academics, is something that Community Jameel does.  It's something that the Family does, and they do it incredibly well.

I want to say congratulations to the Family for 75 years.  I'm at the start of my journey but I am so excited at the future - and if it's anything like what the last little while has been like, I know that it's going to be innovative, it's going to be daring, and it's going to, I think, tackle some of the world's biggest problems and I know that we'll find solutions.  I have that much faith in the organization and the Family.  Thank you.

Title: Amna Fatani

Title: Dr. Simba Gill
Content:
I first met Mohammed through a partnership, and I think a partnership embodies much of what's been remarkable about the Abdul Latif Jameel community over the last 75 years,  and our partnership is focused on something where Mohammed and I have a shared vision.  Which is really trying to tackle what we see as one of the world's most urgent and most important issues.  How  do we discover, develop and deliver innovative and transformative medicines, for all people in the world, with particular focus on what will soon be two billion people in Africa and the Middle East.

What is amazing, is that that's only a tiny piece of what Abdul Latif Jameel is focused on.  And it's always a joy to spend time with Mohammed, because the topics of our discussion range from how do we end world poverty; to discussions about the wonderful world of art; through to the changing world of energy; the changing world of transportation, the movement to electric vehicles; how do we think about fundamentally changing healthcare . . .   and many many more topics.  But in all of those areas Abdul Latif Jameel is having a fundamental impact and really playing a role in accelerating the arrival of a better future.

So, I wanted to congratulate Mohammed and the broader team Abdul Latif Jameel for an amazing 75 years.  I, personally, am looking forward to the next 75 years and many more celebrations and to living in a better and better world, in which Mohammed and the team at Abdul Latif Jameel will have played a fundamental world role in creating.

Title: John Rossant
Content:

Title: Professor Stephen J. Toope
Content:
Dear Mohammed,

Reaching 75 years is remarkable for any company, and at Cambridge we are delighted to congratulate Abdul Latif Jameel, and to celebrate with you.

Achieving this milestone is hardly surprising, given your family’s passion, dedication and commitment to serving others, inspired, of course, by the pioneering spirit of the late Abdul Latif Jameel.  Cambridge is honoured to have had its own relationship with the Jameel family for almost two decades.  Almost halfway through my tenure as Vice-Chancellor, I have grown to cherish the privilege of developing relationships with generous supporters such as the Jameels, whose commitment to solving global challenges is making a real difference, enabling truly life-changing work.

That includes the Cambridge Interfaith Programme (CIP), which promotes understanding of the complex and diverse relationships between religious traditions and the secular world.  Through such understanding comes the flourishing of ideas and the ability to work together to build a better future.

We are profoundly grateful to the Jameel family for enabling the CIP to become a pre-eminent centre for interfaith engagement, attracting outstanding researchers, and setting a foundation on which to build projects that have been emulated at institutions from the US to India to China.  From projects researching the place of religion in modern universities to evaluating the place of religion in serving the common good; from symposiums and summer schools to the publication of a book on scripture and violence, the CIP is at the forefront of developments in religious thought, and ranks amongst the very top programmes in the world.

Through developing links between academia and government and fostering dialogue among policymakers, charities, and museums, the CIP has been able to encourage discussion and respect among communities both nationally and internationally.  The CIP’s A Common Word, a statement of peace and friendship, was signed by more than 130 Muslim scholars.  Christian leaders including Pope Benedict responded and the initiative inspired major international conferences and more than 600 articles in English. 

Such projects make a profound contribution towards peace.

Once more I congratulate you and your family on your tremendous achievements.  Your father’s legacy continues to resonate through your generous philanthropy, and I thank you for placing your trust in Cambridge to fulfil your mission of interfaith and intercultural understanding.

Yours sincerely,

Professor Stephen J. Toope
Vice-Chancellor
The University of Cambridge

Title: James J Collins
Content:
So I'm Jim Collins.  I'm the Termeer Professor at MIT and faculty co-lead at the Jameel Clinic at MIT.

I became involved with Abdul Latif Jameel and Community Jameel and Mohammed and his family with the creation of the Jameel Clinic at MIT which was formed with a tremendously generous gift from Abdul Latif Jameel and Community Jameel.  In the context of the Jameel Clinic I came together with Regina Barzilay, my faculty co-lead, and we together, launched the antibiotics AI initiative in the context of Jameel Clinic and already have discovered a new antibiotic called Halicin, which is effective against multi-drug resistant, extensively drug-resistant, and pan-resistant bacterial pathogens.  And we think with the antibiotics AI project, and the support of Abdul Latif Jameel and Community Jameel, we can harness the power of AI to address the antibiotic crisis giving us a significant competitive advantage in the battle of our wits against the genes of bacterial pathogens.

You know, Community Jameel and Abdul Latif Jameel has had a tremendous global impact.  Really addressing under addressed needs.  This includes healthcare, education water needs and poverty, and in each of those areas Abdul Latif Jameel, Community Jameel has launched, what have become now we're leading research centers at MIT.

I think they're unique in their scope and unique in their interest in having an impact that takes the best innovations we have at MIT and translates them into differences that truly impact people's lives.

So Mohammed and his sons are, very much hands-on collaborators as philanthropists.  We have become great friends over the past few years in the context of Jameel Clinic as well as colleagues and Mohammed and his sons are remarkable in their reach around the world and are always looking to see how they can help advance our projects. So, it very much, U don't view them simply as supporters but as collaborators.

Congratulations to Mohammed and his family, and their team at Abdul Latif Jameel and Community Jameel.  75 years is a remarkable anniversary it's 20 years longer than I have been on  this planet.  And I am very excited to see what Community Jameel will do in the coming decades.  I don't think I have 75 more years but I'm convinced the Community Jameel will have many more than 75 more years to have an impact on this world.

I've, again, I've really appreciated the friendship that I formed Mohammed and his sons and it's rare to establish a relationship with the funder at the level that I've been able to do with Mohammed and his sons, and really be excited to see what we're going to be able to do together as a team.  Identifying  problems that need technological innovation and actually bringing the resource together both capital but even more so the intellectual resources that can make a difference.
